chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon B. Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 202 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1,307.48 plus surcharges.
Spend 6 months in the county jail with huber privileges - Stayed.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Margaret Drees and Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H. Edwards.  Clerk - C. Kreier. On Count 1, court imposes and stays a total sentence of 4 years WSP: 2 years initial confinement w/credit for 202 days served, 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft placed on probation w/conditions for 3 years, 6 months conditional jail stayed w/ huber privileges. On Count 2, court imposes and stays a sentence of 6 months KCJ concurrent to Count 1; deft placed on probation with conditions for 1 year concurrent to Count 1. Deft to submit DNA sample and pay $450.00 surcharge. Restitution ordered in the amount of $1,307.48 by stipulation of the deft. Bond applied to restitution from cases 15CM1460 and 17CF1158.
With Atty Edwards the time of the SEH on 8/7/18 is changed from 1:15pm to 1pm and deft will attempt to make it by that time.
NOH sent to Cities and Villages Mutual Insurance  Returned from the United Postal Service.  Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Sentencing hearing on August 7, 2018 at 01:15 pm.
With Atty Edwards the SEH of 7/18/18 at 2pm is rescheduled, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar; reset to 8/7/18 at 1:15pm.
Presentence incarceration credit.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards. Clerk/H. Barnett. Case set for sentencing. State in victim compliance. State requests adjournment so that more information can be obtained on another of deft's cases. SEH adjourned to 7/18/18 at 2pm. Bond continued.
